data.title: Nothing here is authentically Mexican, but it sure tastes good!
data.text:
El Amerikano is a relatively new (opened in 2014) restaurant owned by the same group that owns the popular Kentro Greek Kitchen.  Both are located in downtown Fullerton and share a parking lot with the Fullerton Transportation Center as well as numerous other restaurants and night clubs.  The area can get very busy so allow yourself a few minutes extra to hunt for a parking space.  You order at the counter and your food is delivered to you at your table.  You usually associate this service style with eateries more focused on speed of service than food quality, but that is not the case here.  The cuisine is delightful.

As with its sister restaurant Kentro, El Amerikano resembles a contemporary gastropub, but a generic one, offering no clues as to what kind of food it serves.  It most often is listed in online guides as Mexican, but it really isn’t; you can't get a rice-and-bean combo plate here.  You can order a margarita, but it will be made with wine rather than tequila.  The food almost defies classification; maybe “Mexican-inspired” or “Latin-centric.”

My party ordered an interesting variety of dishes for dinner:  Asada Brava (grilled rib eye with a Latin rub), prime rib sandwich, grilled fish with cilantro pesto and cucumber ceviche, Rib Eye Picado (steak and vegetables sautéed together with goat cheese and tortillas, the house fries (topped with cilantro, Latin butter and cotija cheese), and their “EL A” Salad (essentially a steak salad).  None of it tasted very Mexican, but it was delicious nonetheless.

The service is friendly and helpful, and the modern décor definitely does not scream “fast food.”  NOTE that you will be paying prices that are comparable to those of a full service restaurant.  Given the quality of the food, we felt that the price was not out of line.  We look forward to our next visit!

data.title: Interesting menu
data.text: There are some interesting items worth trying on their menu.  What we had was very good, as was the service.

data.title: Delicious Flaovor Combinations
data.text: This little restaurant has a high-end feel with counter ordering and very reasonable prices. I ordered the avocado pablano queso with corn chips made fresh on the premises. The blend of flavors was exquisite. Delicate and robust. In addition I ordered the petite house salad with goat cheese and their own red wine vinaigrette dressing. The meal was light and filling. We sat outside and because we had ordered and paid at the beginning we felt we had the time to linger a little longer. Great place for lunch and conversation.

data.title: Hipster Latin Fusion
data.text: Kentro owns Amerikano. I am a weekly eater at Kentro, no joke. I have eaten at El Amerikano a number of times now and I always enjoy my food, however I just can't help but keep going to Kentro instead. Maybe if you didn't know Kentro owned Amerikano you wouldn't be as biased as I am. They did a great job with the menu, some really unique items. It's definitely Latin Fusion...it just usually seems pretty empty so I'm hoping they get enough business to stay open. I'm not sure it can compete with Kentro. I would try it out for sure.

data.title: Very good food!
data.text: The place is very nice. The food is delicious. There is a good variety. We ordered sandwiches and fish.

data.title: Amazing food
data.text: Had dinner here on a Saturday evening. Not crowded at all but I think just because it hasn't been discovered yet.  Food was amazing!  There were four of us and we all thought our meals were wonderful.  I had the portobello enchiladas and at first I was worried that it would be overpowered by the mushroom, but I was so wrong.  Delicious Flavor and amazing sauce.  My husband had a side of the cream corn which is done with a Latin flair and I was lucky to get one bite! We had the graham cracker rice pudding for dessert, wonderful!  Really can't wait to go back.  If there are any negatives,it would be that we ordered two cobblers and after about 5 mins or so, was told they did not have anymore.  This is a sister restaurant to Kentro's (right next door, also amazing and hard to get a seat, always crowded) so same format, order at counter and they bring to the table.

data.title: Love the nachos!
data.text: This is a small place in the corner of Harbor and Commonwealth. The menu is on the wall behind the register, which I guess is so they can change it if need be. I wish the staff was a little bit more friendly. It is just missing that customer service wow factor. It never seems to be busy and I've been quite a few times. Wish they were more involved in the community.

data.title: Margaritas!
data.text: I tried the nachos and the enchilada. Everything was good and tasted fresh. I also had the jalapeño margarita, it was not spicy at all, but it tasted very good. I would definitely order the nachos and the margarita again.

data.title: Good food and not our first visit but....
data.text: This was our 4th visit to El Amerikano and our last for a while. Although the food is excellent and with no complaints about the general service the Manager on our visit last night needs a little reminder regarding customer service. There are plenty of choices regarding places to eat in Fullerton so don't make customers feel unwelcome. The specific reason I say this is due to the fact that we moved 2 tables together as we were waiting for friends to arrive. We were asked that in future we don't do this again. The restaurant was mostly empty at this point and I could understand if we were preventing others from being seated.  We were not. It was unnecessary to be treated in this way in my opinion and so we will take our business elsewhere in future. Competition is good for restaurants and so anything you choose to do to make a negative experience for your customers will mean that you lose business. It is a shame because El American serves great food but so do others in Fullerton and nearby areas.

data.title: Great Addition to the Downtown Area
data.text:
The Hubzz and I were passing through and decided to stop here after reading so many great things about this restaurant.  

Upon walking in, we felt super comfy.  Great ambiance- super casual yet modern and hip.  Counter service- which I'm sure is nice for downtown business people on the run.  Menu- Lovely Latin/Spanish (Spain- people) takes on some favorite items.  

I had the Albondigas- which were large pork meatballs, salsa verde, cotija, cilantro,
cabbage escabeche on the side, ($7)

The Hubzz had the grilled fish sandwich with avocado and citrus slaw.($12)

We shared the  Cauliflower Fritas- fresh cauliflower coated in flour and flash fried with  manchego, cilantro, and a roasted garlic aioli on the side.  ($7)

Prices were super reasonable and the wine list was extensive.  Sad we don't live closer, as I know we would be regulars.  Good luck to this fine restaurant.  They deserve success.  

**Hope this is helpful

data.title: Great Fusion Restaurant
data.text: My favorite is their Chicken Verde that used to be called  Chicken Pandori. It is excellent and I substitute the Kano Slaw for the fries. Do not forget the Cauliflower Fritas. They are best with the dipping sauce.

data.title: Pleasantly surprised.
data.text: We had walked by this place before and passed because it looked more like a fast food place. You order at the counter and then they bring it to the table. After a friend talked about it, we decided to try it out. We will definitely be back. As I stated above, you order at the counter but that is where the comparison with fast food ends. The food was fantastic. I had the skirt steak and my wife had the grilled fish. Both were reasonably priced and were large portions. Even though you order at the counter, service was attentive. Multiple times someone came by our table to ask if we needed anything. The interior is also nothing like fast food. Very comfortable and inviting interior. Give this place a try.

data.title: A new "go to" in Fullerton
data.text: I have been to this restaurant about five times since it opened.  First solo, then bringing friends and lastly bringing a group of seven.  This is a casual dining restaurant.  You order at the counter and the food is served at your table.  It's a small menu but the dishes are packed with flavor.  The menu has a definite Latin bent but it would defy characterization as Mexican or any other Latin ethnicity.  Don't miss the Cauliflower Fritas.  I found the Portobello Fries uninspiring.  The Manchego salad is awesome and plenty for two.  The farro salad is good too.  The patty melt is messy and good with cheddar and manchego cheeses, carmelized onions and Portobello on sourdough.  They have wine and beer.  There is an outdoor patio and dining room is very comfortable.  This is a sister restaurant to Kentro's Greek Kitchen next door.  The same great quality and wonderful wait staff.

data.title: 5 Star Tastes at your "Neighborhood kitchen"
data.text: Went there this evening with an old freind and food lover for the first time.  Totally taken back by the quality and taste of their Latin & American blended cuisine... yes cuisine indeed. Portobello Fries ... who'd thunk this was a good idea.  Slight cornmeal batter with just enough spicey to make them terrific.The 'Warm Mushroom Salad' was another winner.  Entree' was the Al Pastor Chop (pork of course).... so tasty and juicy, I wanted to go back to the kitchen to see how in the hell they did it!  Exceeding expectations would b eputting it mildy.  it sure is fun when you stumble across a average looking place that has apparantly no 'average' food!  Right behind Knowlwood.... easy to miss... but DON'T!

data.title: New addition to my eating places
data.text:
This is a new restaurant that as it is near my workplace I go at lunchtime. On the four visits I have been impressed with the staff the decor and the food. The four stars is to allow a fifth for the "O my God. this is amazing" restaurants. I had the petite fillet on several occasions and they were all perfectly cooked and tender. I really like the fries. Along with other good restaurants I am pretty sure the fries are twice fried French style. This gives a crisp fry that stays throughout the meal. The dover sole was just tasty. Whatever the light crust was combined with the perfectly cooked fish the flavor was great. My wife had the Jidori chicken and declared it "wonderful". Congrats to the management for not short changing the quality of the food and most important, the staff.
English Mike

data.title: Excellent Food, Service, Atmosphere and Price
data.text: We knew that this was also owned by Kentro in Fullerton.  We had never been to Kentro even with the great reviews the restaurant continues to garner.  Onto El Americano, you order at the counter and then the food is brought to your table.  The restaurant presents as a very modernistic setting with a great outside patio dining area.  The staff were professional, smiling and attentive but not overly attentive; just the right amount.  The food was fabulous!! We had the cauliflower fritas, the hamburger, pork chop served with faro salad and a homemade apple cobbler with a gingersnap topping.  The faro salad was everything you would want, up to the excellent goat cheese found throughout the salad.  I can not explain my husband's fries except to say awesome.  We who consider ourselves foodies went to the counter before leaving to complement the service and the food.  This is a wonderful addition to the restaurant scene of downtown Fullerton. We can't wait for our return visit.
